page.title: 18Mrs. Rickman - an interview
page.content: Mrs. Rickman s a dinner lady at our school(Cupernham Junior). We interviewed her on Wednesday June 19th 1985. Mrs. Rickman told us about 'old Romsey'. She was a little girl during the Second World War and she can remember the old Romsey of that time. She was living in the same place for about 35 years. When she grew up she helped her father run the Scout hut by Ganger Farm. It used to get smashed in and they always repaired it so the Scouts could carry on. Near to Ganger Farm there was a prisoner of war camp in the fields. Sometimes they used to visit the camp and speak to the soldiers. The soldiers sometimes gave Mrs. Rickman some apples or sweets. Mrs. Rickman and Mr. Rickman used to have a bomb shelter outside of their house.
